p.seg: Since it is Your Pleasure (Noble Sir) that
I should hold my Fortune from You; like
those Tenants, who pay some Inconside-
rable Trifle in lieu of a Valuable Rent, I
humbly offer You this Poem in Acknowledgment of
my Tenure: and I am well pleas'd with this Occa-
sion to Publish my sense of Your Favours, since it
seems to me a kind of Ingratitude to be Thankful
